title: [Bug]: BrowserView do not auto resize correctly
body:

### Electron Version

30

### What operating system(s) are you using?

Windows, macOS

### Operating System Version

Win10, MacOS13

### What arch are you using?

ia32

### Last Known Working Electron version

29

### Expected Behavior

I used the API "setAutoResize" of BrowserView. 
When BrowserWindow is resized, BrowserView should correctly auto-resize.
```
function createWindow() {
  const mainWindow = new BrowserWindow({
    width: 800,
    height: 600,
    webPreferences: {}
  })

  const view = new BrowserView()

  const [
    width,
    height
  ] = mainWindow.getSize()

  view.setBounds({
    x: 0,
    y: 0,
    width,
    height
  })

  mainWindow.addBrowserView(view)

  view.setAutoResize({
    width: true,
    height: true,
  })

  view.webContents.loadURL('https://www.electronjs.org/')
}
```

### Actual Behavior

The size of the BrowserView changes unexpectedly, causing it to no longer fit the BrowserWindow, and it is almost impossible to restore by resizing the window.
